author: Paige Barnes, WKRC
title: chevron-right
text: CINCINNATI (WKRC) - The deadline for a major house bill banning gender-changing care for minors is in its final days. The bill would also prevent transwomen from playing on girl's sports teams. Local activists and politicians said they are waiting for a decision. If Governor DeWine doesn't take action, House Bill 68 could go into effect without his signature. So, the only option for opponents of the bill is for the governor to veto it. Even if it's vetoed, local republican lawmakers said they have a majority to override it. The Saving Ohio Adolescents from Experimentation, also known as SAVE and Save Women's Sports acts are sitting on the governor's desk. Republican lawmakers are hoping for DeWine's signature. But, the governor said he can't rush to make a decision. "I don’t want to leave anything unknown, and I have the obligation to get as much information as I can before I make a decision," DeWine said. Republican Representative Adam Mathews, a co-sponsor of the bill, said the time has been well spent, and now it's time for Dewine to sign. If he does, Mathews adds it'll bring fairness to sports that isn't there now. "Just like 13-year-olds have their own age limits versus 10-year-olds, we have men and women's sports because on average, there is going to be variation," Mathews (R) Lebanon said. The sports piece of the bill wasn't in the initial draft. It was HB 6 and later combined with gender-affirming care. Trans-rights advocates said medical options for trans youth are vital. "We're talking about two different topics here. We're talking about sports recreation, and we're talking about life or death. That's big. Those two don't need to be grouped together," said PFLAG Cincinnati President Tom Sauer said. Children already receiving gender treatment would be able to continue it. That includes puberty blockers and hormone therapy. "Those future kids won't be given the opportunity, and those future kids are some of the individuals that these major medical groups, like the American Medical Association, is saying they're going to need this care," Sauer said. Representative Mathews disagrees. He said the bill will protect children from surgeries that can't be undone. "It recognizes men and women as both beautiful, but different and protects families [and] protects children," Mathews said. Trans-rights advocates said they'll try to get the law overturned if Dewine signs. Bill co-sponsors said the house has a veto majority. Ohio would join 22 other states that have a law or policy banning youth gender-affirming care. House Bill 68 only impacts trans-athletes playing on female sports teams.

author: Rubaditsha
title: Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 Ending Explained, Release Date, Cast, Plot, Summary and Trailer - News
text: Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Raising Kanan, an American crime drama TV series by Sascha Penn, debuted on Starz on July 18, 2021, as the prequel and second spin-off to Power. Season 3 kicked off on December 1, 2023, offering viewers a continued glimpse into the intricate world of Queens' crime. Prior to this season's debut, in November 2023, the show received a green light for a fourth season, indicative of its sustained popularity and success.Set against the backdrop of the Power universe, Raising Kanan explores the formative years of Kanan Stark, providing insights into the complex relationships and power dynamics that shaped his journey into the criminal underworld. As the narrative unfolds, fans can anticipate more gripping tales and character developments in the forthcoming season.Experience the excitement of the entertainment world. Update yourself now to stay in the loop with breaking celebrity news and explore in-depth film reviews through Fresherslive. Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 Ending Explained In Power Book III: Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4, Raq takes extreme measures to bring Kanan back home, planting a gun in his backpack to avoid federal investigators. Kanan avoids arrest with Detective Howard's help, but now faces six months of random social worker visits at Raq's house. The success of Kanan's weed business is jeopardized, presenting a significant challenge. Raq's questionable tactics in relationships, highlighted by her manipulative actions, strain emotional dynamics with Kanan and Unique. Jukebox secures a spot in the girl group, adding complexity with potential challenges. Unique faces internal issues, and Ronnie's impatience leads to deadly consequences in his pursuit of power. Marvin and Lou-Lou's brotherhood strengthens, emphasizing personal growth. Ronnie's ominous presence hints at future chaos. The episode sets the stage for escalating conflicts and power struggles in the dynamic narrative of Power Book III: Raising Kanan. Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 Release Date Power Book III: Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 was released on Friday, December 22, 2023. Viewers eagerly anticipated the episode, which became available at 9:00 P.M. Pacific Time (PT). The scheduled release time allowed fans across the Pacific Time zone to simultaneously engage with the latest installment in the series. As the date approached, fans were eager to delve into the ongoing narrative, expecting new twists and developments in the storyline. The release time of 9:00 P.M. PT marked the moment when viewers could immerse themselves in the world of Power Book III: Raising Kanan Season 3, witnessing the unfolding drama and character arcs. The past tense indicates that the episode has already been released, offering fans the opportunity to catch up on the latest events in the series. Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 Cast Cast & Crew Role Sascha Penn Creator Malcolm M. Mays Lou-Lou Mekai Curtis Kanan Stark Omar Epps Howard Hailey Kilgore Jukebox Patina Miller Raquel Thomas Toby Sandeman Symphony Bosket London Brown Actor Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 Plot In Power Book III: Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4, titled In Sheep’s Clothing, suspense heightens as Kanan faces a pivotal challenge to his flourishing weed delivery business. Raq, his mother, takes drastic measures to bring him home by planting a gun in his school backpack, leading to a confrontation with school authorities. Despite avoiding arrest with Detective Howard's intervention, Kanan is compelled to move back home due to the social worker's random visits. Raq's unconventional approach to relationships is highlighted as she pauses her connection with Unique. The episode explores the deepening bond between Lou-Lou and Marvin, emphasizing the significance of brotherhood. The enigmatic Ronnie, devoid of smiles, continues to be a menacing presence, foreshadowing potential turmoil in Queens. As the characters navigate personal and professional challenges, the plot intensifies, keeping viewers engaged in the unfolding drama. Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4 Summary In Power Book III: Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4, titled In Sheep’s Clothing, the narrative escalates as Raq takes extreme measures to bring Kanan back home, planting a gun in his school backpack. This pivotal action results in Kanan facing school authorities but avoiding arrest with Detective Howard's intervention.Raq's unconventional relationship dynamics come to the forefront as she puts her son in a precarious situation. Meanwhile, Lou-Lou and Marvin's brotherhood takes center stage, showcasing the positive evolution of their relationship. The enigmatic Ronnie's ominous presence continues to loom large, hinting at potential upheaval in Queens. As personal and professional challenges intensify, the characters grapple with the complexities of their intertwined lives, ensuring an engaging and suspenseful storyline for viewers. Where to Watch Power Book III Raising Kanan Season 3 Episode 4? Presently, the third season of Power Book III: Raising Kanan is available for streaming on various platforms, including the Starz Roku Premium Channel, Spectrum On Demand, Starz Apple TV Channel, Starz, and Starz Amazon Channel. author: stanBiSH
title: X bans woman's account citing \"self harm\" after she tried eating 184 boxes of pocky for Pocky day
text: i missed this while it was happening and unfortunately the account and tweets aren't there anymore, in Japan there is a いいねの数だけポッキー食べる day basically [you](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/10095-you/?synonym=1850) tell people you are going to be doing that and the number of likes you get is the number of pocky you have to eat and later have to post proof some girl (not an idol or actress etc) become know for being active during [that day](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/9764-that-day/?synonym=1553), [2](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/9792-2/?synonym=1574) years ago she [ate](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/10014-ate/?synonym=1777) 350 pockies, past year [1](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/9599-1/?synonym=1493),300 pockies and this year was using pictures of those previous [days](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/9978-days/?synonym=1734) to set a goal the tweet ended getting 19,000 likes she was actually planning to eat 19,000 pockies and because she was serious about it was reported for self harm, her account suspended and tweets related to that deleted so she had to cancel her participation, apologized to supporters and is [now](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/10196-now/?synonym=1965) stuck with almost 200 boxes of pocky although promised to come [back](https://forum.allkpop.com/suite/lexicon/entry/9879-back/?synonym=1684) for 2025's pocky day

author: @netzwelt
title: Gmail-Sicherheitsalarm: 2,5 Milliarden User müssen sich jetzt schützen
text:
GMAIL
Gmail-Sicherheitsalarm: 2,5 Milliarden User müssen sich jetzt schützen
Googles E-Mail-Dienst Gmail ist aktuell das Ziel eines großangelegten Cyberangriffs. Millionen User auf der Welt müssen jetzt Sicherheitsmaßnahmen ergreifen.
Gmail ist einer der beliebtesten Freemailer. Das spiegelt sich allein in der Tatsache wider, dass 2,5 Milliarden Menschen als aktive Nutzer registriert sind - was einem Viertel der Weltbevölkerung entspricht. Diese Beliebtheit wird nur zu gerne von Cyberkriminellen ausgenutzt. Allein in diesem Jahr warnte Google schon mehrere Male vor großangelegten Attacken.
Auch aktuell haben es Hacker wieder auf die User von Gmail abgesehen. In Support-Foren und auf Reddit wird immer mehr von unerwartete Warnungen und Alarmmeldungen berichtet, die angeblich von Google stammen. In Wahrheit stecken jedoch Betrüger dahinter, die mit Phishing-Methoden an sensible Daten gelangen wollen.
Sicherheitslücke in WhatsApp: Sind eure Chats jetzt nicht mehr privat?Schwachstelle
Die Nachrichten-Verschlüsselung von WhatsApp ist von einer neuen Sicherheitslücke betroffen. So wirkt sich die Gefahr auf eure Chats aus.
Fake-Support klaut euer Passwort
Laut den Erfahrungsberichten auf Reddit und Co. geben sich die Kriminellen am Telefon als Mitarbeitende vom Google-Support aus. Sie behaupten, dass euer Account das Ziel von Hackern sei, weshalb die Änderung eures Passworts nötig sei. Mit geschickter Überredungskunst wollen sie euch dann dazu bringen euren Sicherheitscodes zu teilen, der für die Passwortänderung benötigt wird.
Lasst euch von dieser gefälschten Sicherheitsmaßnahm nicht täuschen. Gelangt der Code in die falschen Hände, könnt ihr innerhalb von Sekunden aus eurem Konto ausgesperrt werden. Daten- und Identitätsdiebstahl können die Folge sein. Wie Forbes berichtet verbirgt sich hinter der ausgeklügelten Attacke die Hackergruppe ShinyHunters, die in der Vergangenheit auch eine Datenbank von Google kompromittierten.
Diese Nutzer sind besonders Betroffen
Im Grunde kann es jeden der 2,5 Milliarden Gmail-User treffen. Doch für Nutzer mit großer Reichweite oder häufig genutzten Domains besteht ein erhöhtes Risiko. Aber auch wenn ihr die Google Cloud nutzt, müsst ihr euch derzeit vor Cyberangriffen in Acht nehmen.
Die Angreifer greifen dabei auf sogenannte "dangling buckets" zurück. Dabei handelt es sich um Stellen in Code, Apps oder Dokumentationen, die auch nach der Löschung vom Google Cloud Storage auf euren Namen verweisen.
Kostenlose E-Mail-Adresse: Das sind die 10 besten Freemailer 2025Kostenlose E-Mail-Programme
Ihr braucht eine neue Mail-Adresse, aber bitte ohne Abo-Falle, Datenklau oder Spam-Flut? Kein Problem. Wir zeigen euch die besten kostenlosen Freemailer 2025, sagen, was sie wirklich taugen - und worauf ihr besser verzichten solltet.
Angreifer können dann einfach denselben Namen erneut registrieren (meist in einem eigenen Cloud-Account) und so den alten Speicherort kapern, um etwa Malware auszuliefern oder Daten abzugreifen, die immer noch auf die alte Adresse zugreifen.
So sichert ihr euer Gmail-Konto
Um euch zu schützen, solltet ihr umgehend entsprechende Maßnahmen ergreifen. Je schneller ihr handelt, desto geringer ist das Gefahrenpotenzial für euch. Wir empfehlen euch die folgenden Sicherheitsschritte auszuführen:
- Zweistufige Authentifizierung (2FA) aktivieren: Selbst wenn euer Passwort gestohlen wird, könnt ihr die Kontoübernahme verhindern.
- Verdächtige Mails genau prüfen: Klickt nicht unüberlegt auf Links und überprüft Absenderadressen.
- Starke, einzigartige Passwörter verwenden: Greift für die Erstellung und Verwaltung am besten auf einen
Passwort-Managerzurück. - Passkey statt Passwort: Ein Passkey ist sicherer als ein Kennwort und dient als digitaler Schlüssel.
- Wachsam bleiben: Vor allem bei ungewöhnlichen Login-Versuchen oder Sicherheitswarnungen in euren Google-Einstellungen.
Zusätzlichen Schutz vor Phishing-Attacken und anderen Cyberbedrohungen kann ein Antivirenprogramm bieten. Welche Software wirklich schützt, verrät unser Virenschutz-Test.

author: Office of Advocacy
title: EPA Announces Two Public Meetings of the Science Advisory Board Environmental Justice Science and Analysis Review Panel
text:
On June 25, 2024, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) announced two public meetings of the Science Advisory Board (SAB) Environmental Justice Science and Analysis Review Panel.
The purpose of the meetings is to discuss the panel’s draft peer review report of the EPA’s draft Revised Technical Guidance for Assessing Environmental Justice in Regulatory Analysis. The Panel will also discuss their self-initiated commentary outlining recommendations on advancing environmental justice science in rulemaking.
The meeting dates are:
- July 25, 2024, from 1:00 to 5:00 PM ET
- July 30, 2024, from 1:00 to 5:00 PM ET
The meetings will be conducted virtually. Participants can
register for the meetings on the Science Advisory Board’s website.
Persons interested in providing oral statements, which will be limited to three minutes, should notify the SAB by July 22, 2024, to be placed on the list of registered speakers.
Written statements should be submitted by July 22, 2024, for consideration at the July 25 and 30, 2024 meetings.
Read the Federal Register notice announcing the meetings.
- Advocacy contact: Send an email to Nick Goldstein at .

organizations.name: environmental justice science and analysis review panel
revised technical guidance for assessing environmental justice in regulatory analysis
